title: Admin Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Too slow! The process at U of T is just super slow. I applied online to the role & then I searched to find the department's email address to just tell them that I've applied and consider my application, rather than that they won't normally for the online applications! They answered me but it took them 2,3 weeks to give me an interview and after the interview which I really studied for it and mostly my answers were related as my work experience was closely related to the job posting, it took them almost 2 months to say NO!
Interview Questions: What was interesting to you about this job? regarding your experience what will you bring to this department?

title: Python Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: go over my resume, talk about my plan, and ask some questions from my resume and overwork experience, and study project, also he asked me like why this job, and why this company.
Interview Questions: he asked me like why this job, and why this company.

title: Standardized Patient (SP) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with a few individual questions. Very straightforward. Not sure what the process is like currently. The interviewers were very nice and easy to talk to, they were open and wanted honesty from us.
Interview Questions: Have you every participated in experiential learning previously?

title: Digital Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involves an interview online, meeting with the Marketing Manager and discussing role interest as well as conducting review of your resume. The Marketing Manager is very kind and well spoken.
Interview Questions: What interested you in applying for the job?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: They were very kind, personable, and friendly. The conversation went very smoothly, they were interested in what I had to say and asked to elaborate on some things which I was happy to do. They were interested in seeing my portfolio and didn't try to hide that they were impressed.
Interview Questions: Walk us through your experience in graphic design.

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy wait time from initial contact to learning I was not given an offer. Interview required a presentation. Staff was kind but did not provide written questions. Role was unclear.
Interview Questions: Case scenarios Approach to advising

title: Web Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Generic behavioural interview, the interviewers were very nice and easy going. They asked about my past experiences that matched the job posting and how I can be an addition to the team
Interview Questions: Describe a time you were in group setting and there was a difficult person to work with

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: The interview process at the University was lengthy with many panels and people that I spoke with. This is very typical of the university as I have seen during my time here.
Interview Questions: Name a difficult situation you have been in

title: Assistant Store Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Great University, Interview experience is very awesome, and the interviewer was very polite, I have done it through the online so I can not tell you more about the places but yeah the overall experience was i would say is good
Interview Questions: About my self and general questions

title: Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward interview department manager and two other staff from the department which was conducted virtually through Zoom. Interview took 15 minutes and was quite casual, asking the typical interview questions.
Interview Questions: What would you like to gain from this position?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: 3 committee members interviewed me via Microsoft Teams. It was pretty straightforward, and they were extremely professional and friendly. Took less than a week after an interview to receive an offer.
Interview Questions: Questions on research background, teaching experience, and questions around inclusion and equity.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: At the same time, you need to conduct group discussions on two projects in a group of five people. After the group discussion, we need everyone to give a presentation and take questions from everyone.
Interview Questions: in two seniors to discussion

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: It was very challenging and competitive. I had two interviews. One interview was a regular one while the other was a journal club. A lot of questions were asked. Some questions were common in both the interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell us your research background? Why this program? Future plans? describe a problem that you overcame?

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: The length of the interview was long. It was 2 hours in total. I first had a 30 min ppt presentation, and then did two assignments. The two assignments were both related to the job descriptions. There were 3 interviewers in the room, so made me a little nervous.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Why should we hire you?

title: Credentialing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was quick and efficient. Straight forward application form, followed by email and call. Discussed job roles and expectations. Unfortunately it was not a match, but a pleasent experience in summation.
Interview Questions: Describe knowledge of education-related documentation

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward - had an interview with the PI about mutual interests and goals, and the exact project I would work on. Also met the research group where they described their projects.
Interview Questions: What would you like to study if there were no constraints?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fairly straightforward. Typical questions around strengths, weaknesses, scenario-based questions, and questions about building and fostering equity as a part of the job. Met with 2 people on the hiring team, only had one interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you handled conflict

title: MFE Applicant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Recordings with several questions. Qs are randomly selected in Economics, Finance and Mathematics. Mainly Macroeconomics and macro-finance questions are likely to be asked. Overall have 8 questions. You will have time to prepare, and every question has only one attempt.
Interview Questions: 1. The impact of AI on bank product sales. 2. Interest rate relevant questions (I forgot)

title: HR Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: There was a virtual group interview to go over experience and the role - about 4-5 questions not too long. 2nd interview was asked to create a short presentation on benefits. The interview process was pleasant and gave a chance to get to know the interviewer as well.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the role, what are your long term goals, how do you deal with conflicts.

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Scarborough, ON) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Required to give a 20 min presentation. Interview questions are pre-prepared and written on a piece of paper for you to read. I was told there would be a second interview
Interview Questions: How would you create a program to help PhD students find jobs

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview- 45 min, standard interview questions. Position was contract through if UTemp, the university’s short term pool and needed to be filled immediately. Two person panel who were professional but warm.
Interview Questions: How would you handle multiple priorities? How are your Microsoft office skills?

title: Knowledge Mobilization Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an email requesting an interview. Attended one in-person interview with four panelists: three supervisors and one HR person. It took about an hour. Was notified by phone call that I didn't get the role.
Interview Questions: Give an example of how you handled a project with competing timelines.

title: Director, School of Continuing Studies Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: This role isn't quite right, but that's also because they posted a job, interviewed a bunch of people then decided not to continue with the job and didn't let any of the interviewees know. Had to find out from someone who works there that they no longer decided to have the role in the organization
Interview Questions: Lots of behavioural, "how would you approach" and then a situation about conflict (red flag) or designing something (normal)

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The admissions interview at the University of Toronto (UofT) is an immersive experience that aims to unravel the multifaceted qualities of prospective students. Stepping into the interview room, candidates are greeted by a panel of esteemed faculty members whose warmth and expertise instantly put them at ease. The atmosphere is one of intellectual curiosity and mutual respect, as the interviewers seek to assess not only the academic prowess but also the personal qualities and potential of each applicant. Through thought-provoking questions and engaging discussions, the interview becomes a platform for candidates to showcase their intellectual curiosity, critical thinking, and ability to articulate their aspirations. The interviewers carefully listen, offering guidance and encouraging the candidates to shine, fostering an environment that truly embodies UofT's commitment to academic excellence and holistic education.
Interview Questions: How can employers be more equitable?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: No interview you just submit your materials through the portal and then get notified if you have been selected for the job and then you typically have a meeting with your supervisor.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your background?

title: Student Technology Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty standard, had the typical “what are your strengths/weaknesses” alongside the “describe a time where you demonstrated x” where you explain a former problem you helped solve.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you demonstrated problem solving.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: On-line interview with the the UofT group. It took about 1 hour. including tech skills questions and behavioral questions. Approx 5-6 questions in total. Not too difficult to answer them.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in dat aanalysis

title: Faculty Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: - public speaking (tell us why we should consider you for the position) - behavioural interview questions (time management, technical skills, project management) - performance task during the interview to test technical skills - took over a month to get back to us - gave feedback
Interview Questions: Tell us how you prioritize

title: Ice Skating Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Toronto in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: interview was super chill and process went really fast. I got an offer within a day. had an online interview. didn't have to prepare much either since the questions were straight forward.
Interview Questions: what makes a good instructor?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Casual. Just talked with a post-doc and then a prof at a lab I was interested in. I like donuts and dislike mice. Trains are nice but hens are better.
Interview Questions: What program are you in?

title: Document Reviewer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: This place has went off the deep end. The whole interview focused on diversity. They are openly discriminating against men and whites in their hiring practices. If you find that hard to believe, have a look at the staff composition in all of their administrative offices. Wokeness personified.
Interview Questions: They asked what I think of diversity.

title: Outreach Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was about an hour long with 5 members working in the department, and later followed by a 2.5 hour long test. The interview questions were specific to the job, and based on past experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good candidate for this position?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward process that involved presenting research and speaking with a committee about plans for future research and teaching. Focus was more on research than teaching, but the committee running the search was friendly and allowed for all relevant information to be presented.
Interview Questions: What are my future plans for research?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions:
The professor will email you after review your resume.
Then you will have a 30-minute chat on zoom about some basic deep learning questions and some course projects. Then you will discuss the project direction with the professor.
Interview Questions: Could you explain loss function of word2vec?

title: Career Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very kind, a traditional work study interview type. Ask about resume and all the other related stuff, but asked if any experience for CRM system. Pretty easy and chill answers.
Interview Questions: Are u familiar with CRM systems

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: The interview following the application for the engineering programs was very straightforward. They would ask questions and you simply provide answers for. As long as there are preparation, there is no problem in performing well in the interview.
Interview Questions: What to do in a certain scenario

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was extremely informal. I submitted my CV and research materials. I was contacted, which led to a zoom interview. Meeting involved  a long conversation about what I want to do, why it would be impactful, and how I would do it.
Interview Questions: Interview was informal, and involved a long conversation about what I want to do, why it would be impactful, and how I would do it.

title: HR Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Very basic questions, pretty straight forward, but overall I did not feel welcome and I did not like their approach. I do not recommend it. They asked questions about my experience  at other companies. Pretty normal.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and your experience.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: The process was conversational, we walked through my resume and focused on past experience working with students, the challenges I faced and how I overcame them.  We also discussed past classes which were relevant.
Interview Questions: How would you work with students that are less engaged to improve their learning experience?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: They give you about 2-3 weeks notice that you have an interview. Very long interview questions and a practical exercise but quick to let you know if you have the job

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: - First the employers introduce themselves and the contribution of their department - Secondly, I gave a brief introduction about my self, including my past experience in UX design and project management - In the rest of the time, they asked me about the details of the experience related to UX/UI design and some methods I would use in assisting the supervisor. - Lastly, I answered a question which was pre-posted by the employers.
Interview Questions: Describe your past experience about UX design

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Online meeting, ask why I am interested in this program, why I chose UofT, describe yourself, and ask some questions about my resume. No technical questions, interviewers are nice to talk.
Interview Questions: why I am interested in this program,

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: The questions were pretty typical, but I found out they score your answer with points for mentioning certain things so it's in your best interest to give LONGER answers: try to mention MULTIPLE things and give a real example for everything even if they don't request it, you might get more points that way.
Interview Questions:
- How I've dealt with interpersonal disagreement 
- What I would do next if I made a mistake
- My experience with various types of marketing 
- My experience developing or applying a strategy 
- How I work with other people

title: Teaching Assisstantship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Video interview with the power point prepared. Introduce yourself and go through the resume.Video interview with the power point prepared. Introduce yourself and go through the resume.Video interview with the power point prepared. Introduce yourself and go through the resume.
Interview Questions: Video interview with the power point prepared. Introduce yourself and go through the resume.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Initial screening was done through a phone interview followed another technical round through Zoom.Finally in person interview was done. Interview process was friendly and comfortable with a genuine interest to know about my skills and research interest.
Interview Questions:
) introduce yourself
2) details about experience
3) expectations from the role
4) where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: easy, it was a group interview and the questions were easy to answer. nothing hard. we were all offered jobs. definitely a good student job for those looking for experience
Interview Questions: describe a way you would coach

title: Senior Project Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: They asked for a report followed by a one hour interview and then a technical test of one hour. The report was based on data analysis exercise and the interview had general project management and communication questions. The technical test had two questions.
Interview Questions: How would I promote equity and diversity?

title: Collaborator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Ask prior experiences about collaboration with various levels of students, ability of multi tasking, also a few behaviour question like tell me a time you step up and take the leadership role
Interview Questions: Have you had prior experience as a collaborator ?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: The zoom interview felt very cold with questions asked and no real time left for conversation.  I didn't feel like I got a good feel for the role even though I asked my own questions at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: They were all so long I can hardly remember them.  They were kind enough to put the multi-part questions in the chat window but it would have been much easier to do it conversation style.

title: Project Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Conversation with one of the advisors about the project and the general purpose of it. Also, conversation about personal experience with relation to similar projects. Explanation about the position, requirements and additional information regarding the job.
Interview Questions: Personal interest on the project and which skills of mine would benefit the project

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: I had a 30-minute microsoft teams interviews with 3 employers, and they gave about 7 questions,  walked through my resume and portfolio. They were strict and not that welcoming though.
Interview Questions:
Introduce yourself.
Do you have a design experience?

title: Accompanist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Describe the overall experience of major collaborative work, different styles of repertoire, some interview questions about background studies, important engagements. Interview was overall in a nice environment, very friendly and supporting
Interview Questions: Tell me your past experience with collaborative work

title: Executive Director Dev Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview process. Happy they provided accommodation for me and had the questions in writing. Typical interview process. Happy they provided accommodation for me and had the questions in writing.
Interview Questions: How would I support instructors in my role

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: I had a quick phone interview with a secretary than an in-person interview with the supervisor.  I met members of the laboratory and the lab technician.  It was over an hour long process showing where things were and what the lab is known for, etc.
Interview Questions: Q: What's your future plans?

title: Call Center Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: they call up to set an interview and then also do a demo call with you in person after teaching you the steps. not bad, just expecting people who can handle situations calmly
Interview Questions: Important attribute when dealing with calls

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Two Interviews - One wet screening and one dry land interview. Standard NL procedures and standards, such as DNS, spinals, and a couple first aid scenarios were tested. The job is mostly students, so managers are very nice.
Interview Questions: What is your lifeguarding experience?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: The professor will conduct a 30-min video interview.  In general, it covers the questions about the course context,. There won't be too many difficult technical questions, though sometimes it depends on different course levels. The overall experiences are good!
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you managed a team.

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: You need to record a 30 min video to answer the assigned questions. The first apart is introduction. The second part is a technical problems. You are not allowed to re-do the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself (background)?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: basic behavioural and theory questions related to the subject matter, how you like to work, if you enjoy collaborating with other researchers, what coursework you've taken that is relevant,  what excites you about research, future plans in academia or in industry, etc.
Interview Questions: what do you like about research

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions:
greatful process， there are two  people there to ask
me question. And the whole process is related with  why you want to choose this program and your information. During that process, i introduce myself and talking something about the my career goal
Interview Questions: do you also apply for other program

title: Student Transitions Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a interview carousel. Interviewees would go to assigned Zoom rooms at the assigned times. It is a long interview process; about 6 hours. While it is a long process it is typically the only one. This interview style works for online interviews but would be very difficult to replicate in person.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strengths? What motivates you to put forth your greatest effort?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: There were multiple interviewers and they were all very friendly people. It was carousal style, but they were still welcoming and provided all the necessary information about the role during the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this role?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: meet with PI to go over my previous research and general research interests; PI introduced the research topics at their lab; optional to meet with current lab members; no committee interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about your Master Thesis

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interviews with professors and other members of the department, to try and find a lab which is a good fit. Expectations of both the student and supervisor are also considered.
Interview Questions: What is your previous lab experience

title: Master of Applied Computing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: The process is basically going over the resume and chatting about why chose this program. Also, they might ask about past research experience and what direction of research is expected for the future.
Interview Questions:
Q: Why choose our program
Q: What research direction do you prefer and why?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: it's a relatively casual and smooth process. I was interviewed by a PHD researcher and he basically just went through my CV and asked about some of my technical skills.
Interview Questions: What is your research interest

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was decently quick. The people were nice but be prepared for the brain teaser at the end of the session. Prepare to talk about your CV in detail and the projects you deal with on a daily basis.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself in detail.

title: Ropes Course Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: I had a positive experience interviewing for the course instructor position. The interview process went well, and just generally expected questions such as teaching approaches and teaching experience at graduate level teaching.
Interview Questions: Please describe your teaching approaches.

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Clear and smooth. Process is straight forward and clear. Initial contact was with HR. Questions are clear, concise and come from a panel. Had the opportunity to ask my own questions as well.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Emailed with a time and link to meet (during COVID). Standard questions were asked and a job outline/expectations were provided. Sometimes a reference letter or contact was asked to be provided before or after the interview itself.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and what this position entices you?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: One interview with my supervisor and manager. Very simple and relaxed interview more focused on job tasks. Got an offer very quickly after.  Less intimidating than other more structural interviews at other companies.
Interview Questions: What features of Zoom are you familiar with?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and then was contacted via email. Scheduled an interview onsite. The interview was pretty easy and just some behaviral questions. Finally I got the job but I declined due to recent final weeks.
Interview Questions: Describe when you solve a problem using creative approach.

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Was asked multiple behavioural questions off a list, then asked to assemble a computer in front of the interviewer (it was an IT help position). A bit on the rails, but nothing too crazy.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with databases before?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: was very simple, technical questions with research questions, was for a science lab. the interviewer was very nice and the interview didnt last too long.  got an offer but decided to pursue other options.
Interview Questions: technical questions about programming and experiment design

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: The interview goes smoothly, no technical question is asked. There are 3 interviewers, I feel quite nervous in this situation. They did explain the application they are working on in detail.
Interview Questions: Describe a project you made

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Simple library job that requires the employee to shelve books, scan them, etc. The job requires you to pay attention to detail and be punctual. Overall the interview process was not very hard
Interview Questions:
What can you add to the team?
Are you punctual?

title: Undergrade Scholarship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: select your own time and answer some questions during the recording process and try to have a stable internet connection and get yourself ready with pencil and scratch paper. It is not hard but the preparations are recommended to have in advance.
Interview Questions: tell me about one of the achievements you made

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online for work study position
Submitted resume and cover letter
Contacted me in 2-3 weeks for an interview
They asked pretty standard questions, nothing out of the ordinary
Contacted me 4 days after the interview
I accepted the position
Interview Questions:
What are your weaknesses?
What software have you used before?

title: Student (Undergrad) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: It was a behavorial interview which lasted for about 30 minutes. There were 2 or 3 recorded questions and one written question. It took about 30-45 minutes. They also provided practice interview materials.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself and Why you are a fit for UofT?

title: Assistant Professor, Teaching Stream Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: (For UTSC) They showed enthusiasm and I spent nearly a week preparing for the interview. The interview seemed to go well. Afterwards I found out that they had someone in mind for the position all along.
Interview Questions: Asked me to define my field. I gave a brief definition and they tried to repeat it back but actually said something completely different. Assuming I was clear, this shows they had not listened.

title: Database Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: There 2 rounds. First round  is  technical questions what software you previously used and what kind of projects you have done before and second round is behaviour questions with department manager. Both two interviews went around30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with Access?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview process - phone interview, then panel interview with direct report, HR rep, and stakeholders. This is followed by a technical skills test, done online. Afterwards, they will contact your references and if all is well, extend the offer.
Interview Questions: What are some projects that you've worked on in the past? How did you handle the difficulties you encountered?

title: Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: This interview was conducted virtually. I met with the Director of Student Services and the Communications Officer and was asked a series of questions about my communications experience and approach. I was then asked to complete a 45 min writing test where they provided me with bullet point information about a fictional award that was given to a faculty member and asked me to write a 300 word article.
Interview Questions: Describe a communications plan that you executed? What made it successful?

title: Undergraduate Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: For the Department of Family and Community Medicine. It was a panel interview with 5 or 6 people. Standard questions. Everyone was lovely except for the director, who kept rolling her eyes and sighing heavily at me as I answered questions. I excused myself and then withdrew from the competition. That kind of behaviour is a bad omen of an abusive working environment, and I won't put up with it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Customer Experience Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Got an interview with them through Microsoft Office Teams. Asked a variety of behavioural questions as well as customer experience questions. Good process overall. I had two interviewers and each were prepared and nice.
Interview Questions: When was a time you went above and beyond for a customer?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: 2 round interviews. The first round is a group interview, role-play as RA and solve the actual problems, the second part is an individual interview and chats with a recruiter.
Interview Questions: How do you fit the job?

title: Data Architect Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: No first screening interview. Just exchanged a couple of emails with their HR staff, where I answered some questions and filled some forms. Then a panel interview of three which lasted for an hour and a half.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Credentials Assessor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions:
I was interviewed by three people. They all sat in comfortable chairs around a long table. Meanwhile, they made me sit at the edge of the table which was quite uncomfortable as I was right up against the steel table legs. I was not at ease during the whole interview, even more so when they gave me a small laptop to do a writing exercise at that same edge of the table. 

I recall a time when almost all job interviews would have a friendly and engaging tone. It was understood by all parties that even though you weren't guaranteed the job, everyone could nonetheless be pleasant and encourage open, cordial conversation. That was not the case at this interview. This was more of an ultra-modern, bureaucratic tone where the company obviously chose to project a cold and disengaged demeanour. Sadly, this now seems to be more and more the norm for job interviews.
Interview Questions:
The questions were mostly situational and the tone was cold and mechanical.

They concluded by asking me for my thoughts on diversity in the workplace.

title: TALint Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: I received the questions ahead of the interview and got 30mins to prepare. The interview was pleasant and interviewers are nice and friendly. Most of the questions are about my own experiences and the requirement of the position.
Interview Questions: Why would you choose this position?

title: Program Evaluation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was arranged very close to the date when I received Email from the hiring manager. It was a very friendly interview that lasted for about 20 minutes. There were only me and my hiring manager in the interview, and she recorded all my answers down.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience performing literature review?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Question about time commitment, aka how many courses  I am taking and then  gave data validation task to be completed and returned the day of the interview. No behaviourals asked.
Interview Questions: What are your time commitments?

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied through UoT career. Got an online interview schedule and was interviewed by 4 people. Very easy going interview where they were trying to gauge how the person would fit in. Got a call after 2 weeks to inform that I was not selected.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time when you handled a situation with external vendors?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: The interview involved questions about the role and the research area. It was a relatively casual  process but questions required preparation and experience relevant to the role. Also some general interview questions related to interpersonal skills and teamwork.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness? What experiences do you have that are relevant to the position?

title: Grant Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: They prefer to ask about your contributions in previous positions, your exp in the education industry, and such as that. Unfortunately, I never worked in the education industry, so I got no following up response.
Interview Questions: They asked me whether I have experience working in the education industry.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth, but with a slow response time from application submission to hearing back from them. Two rounds first technical and then behavioral interviews. The decision came in a week or so.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your skills and qualifications

title: Summer Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great, I already had funding so it focused mainly on what types of projects my supervisor had available and which ones I was interested in and how that could fit together.
Interview Questions: Describe to me what you already know about environmental modelling

title: Assistant Help Desk Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Efficient and positive experience to work at the university help desk. Emphasis on strong customer service skills and technical problem solving. The 1-on-1 interview itself can be long, but it's not intimidating as long as you know some basic IT troubleshooting, have used common operating systems, and can be professional in customer-facing roles.
Interview Questions: Teach me how to do something in-depth in 5 minutes. Roleplay type questions like a user not being able to log into a website. Basic networking questions like subnetting, SMTP, TCP/IP, ...

title: Laboratory Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: 1. I first reached out to the professor, one that I had a class with, through email expressing my interest in their plant research and gaining a role in it. The email was basically in the format of a cover letter and I attached my resume. I mentioned my interest in plants, how I then pursued a job at the university’s greenhouse, and how that experience sparked my interest in their course, and ultimately led me to being interested in joining their lab. I specifically mentioned which research from their lab website I was interested in. 2. There were two interviews, first with the prof, and then with the with a post-doc I could potentially work for under the lab. Both on Zoom.
Interview Questions: How did you find my research?

title: Web Developer (Work/Study) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Discussed with professor about the job and my qualifications. It is more like a small talk, because there are not many students applying for the job. We also discussed detailed implementation of the website.
Interview Questions: What is your last experence of developing a website

title: Undergraduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: 3 questions composed of 1 written with 2 video questions. You have 2 to 3 minutes to answer each question. You can pause before you start. You can also practice your interview unlimited times.
Interview Questions: tell me briefly about yourself and your interests.

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process, it went from being a volunteer to being paid as a student assistant assisting with research . They ask about your skillsets, if you know the professor they will usually bump you up from a volunteer
Interview Questions: What skills can you offer

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Hiring panel with three members of the faculty, questions about your academic history and your aptitude for teaching. There was only one round of interviews and I was contacted about my status about a week following.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you found most difficult during your own learning as a student?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Really great, done through skype. Great cooperation with cic and ircc process. I came from outside canada a d they were so kind with providing information and help whenever needed
Interview Questions: Lecturing for phd stude ts

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward and standard questions. Took about 20 min and had a really great chat. Mostly about general class format, grading guidelines, structure, expectations etc.  I was emailed by the professor and we arranged a zoom call.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: After you send in your application, which usually consists of a  cover letter and resume, you get an email if you're selected for an interview.  Connection with the person you want to work for is very important!
Interview Questions: Your previous work experience and connection to the project. What do you want to learn from it?

title: SIA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Concise, remote, and largely dependent on previous experience. If you have previously worked as a TA or SIA the process will likely be very short; if not, there may be some follow up involved.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have teaching?

title: Learning Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through the website and prepared a resume and cover letter. 
Telephone screening with representative from human resources.
Invited to 1.5 hour video interview with request to deliver presentation. Panel of 4 staff on interview.
Email correspondence with HR.
Interview Questions:
Experience working with challenging projects.
Instructional design experience.

title: Co-op Student (Head Office) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: It started with a phone interview screening process and then moved onto an in person interview on campus. There were two separate interviews with different hiring managers. The interview was heavily focused on behavioural situations and management skills.
Interview Questions: What do you bring to the team?

title: Work Study Student - Junior Identity Access Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Very fluid, got to meet up with the team, and had a interview with 3 other board members. Gave behavioral questions and a brief explanation of my current projects I am working on.
Interview Questions: What does a database mean to you?

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Interview is informal, typical questions are asked such as tell me about yourself, and it is very chill. Nothing asked about technical skills. They asked mainly about etc etc etc etc etc etc. I don't have too much to say other than that.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself etc.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, got an email a week later for an onsite group interview.  A week after the group interview, I was invited to a second round of individual interview.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Tell me about a time where you had to deal with an unsatisfying participant.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Video call interview that lasted approximately 40 minutes. Flexibility was given regarding to when the interview would be conducted and answers to questions were replied within 2 days through email.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Describe a time when you had to be very attentive to the smaller details.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: it was short impersonal and last minute. They emailed me 1 day before the in person interview and did not provide an alternate time. Would gave liked more notice and more information
Interview Questions: If you could be any animal what animal would you be?

title: Data Analyst Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: There is only one round of interview after I applied online (Clnx). There is one case presentation plus several behavioral questions. The manager will email relevant interview questions in advance.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience coding, cleaning, data (quant or qual)? What would be your process for getting a data set ready for analysis?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Just a discussion on potential research.  A brief description of the job responsibilities and duties. Asked about previous experience on several research projects.  A quick overview of the publication records.
Interview Questions: When are you gonna start?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: You met with a professor who is in charge of hiring in their office. It was only 1 round of interview before decisions were made. Decisions generally took a few weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do want to work as a TA?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Employed from work study program. First, submit resume and cover letter. Second, make an appointment with the supervisor if contacted. Third, have an interview with the supervisor. The interview lasts about 15 min. Several basic questions where asked.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time?

title: Master Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions:
Online application, skype interview
need reference letter (2), transcript, resume, cover letter, 
the process is simple, but cgpa needs to be over 3.00 for 24 months
Online application, skype interview
need reference letter (2), transcript, resume, cover letter, 
the process is simple, but cgpa needs to be over 3.00 for 24 months
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: To the point and engaging.  In other words, the interview process was done in a way to highlight your passion as well as discuss ideas regarding research methodology, academic integrity, and expectations.
Interview Questions: Are you passionate about this type of research?

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied on the portal with resume, Cl, transcript. Got a reply from employer the next day. I was assigned a small task to do before the interview. Did an interview and got the job!
Interview Questions:
My background, courses I have taken, past experiences.
What are your future plans after graduation?

title: Course Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I responded the the university job add by completing a form, attaching my cover letter and CV. I also provided the names of 2 references. I was contacted via email to do an interview after they shortlisted applicants to 3 out of 30.
Interview Questions: Knowledge about the department and its students

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Just an application on company website. Quite simple with a few questions. Asked to solve problems and added a transcript as well. Asked for references and past relevant experience too. Should not be too difficult if you really know your stuff.
Interview Questions: What was your past experience with teaching?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Initial Form asking basic questions for reason of interest and background.

If selected, continue to interview process. Usually occurs in person, but due to pandemic was shifted to a pre-recorded interview. Prepare a video that answers the questions provided.
Interview Questions: Example  Lesson, how to deal with lack of student engagement, and what extra-curricular activities have you been part of

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: submit a CV and prepare a presentation for in person interview. It really depends on which lab you are apply to and what the funding situation is at that moments
Interview Questions: based on your projects

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Presentation of previous work and questions asked about detailed work in the presentation, future scientific aspirations, number of publications, ability to collaborate with other scientists on different projects, at the end asked about salary. You must negotiate your salary. Initial offer is minimum.
Interview Questions: what are your future directions after you postdoc

title: Digital Media and Marketing Graphic Designer for TCard+ Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: apply through school cln website, the process took about 2 weeks, did an phone interview, they are very nice and good atmosphere. Later on, I received an acceptance email.
Interview Questions: what kind of promotion method would you implement for TCard+

title: Post Doctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: It was a skype video call session that lasted roughly 45 minutes and was a on-on -one session with the PI. The interview was casual and was more like a conversation than a technical interview.
Interview Questions: The questions were fairly straightforward and revolved around my current research, publications as well as the potential project in my new role

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds: one with each professor. Asked about how well technical and culture fit are for their research groups. Technical side assessed research-specific side (know the software they use and how to use it), research articles they published, etc.; and the fit side had behavioural questions (i.e., tell me about a time where you...)
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you took an initiative

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty standard interview with behavioural questions, why you want the role, where you see yourself in the future? The lab manager and the graduate student were there.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself?

title: Finance Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Behavioural interview on the phone and then an in person interview with several managers. In person interview included behavioural questions and general questions based on experiences listed on the resume. There were also several questions in relation to projects one would be working on if hired for the position.
Interview Questions: You are given a project where you do not possess all the required information. How do you approach the situation.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly informal but this can vary with which lab you are applying to. The PI with whom I interviewed mainly ran through my CV and asked me to elaborate on specific experiences.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to go into research?

title: Senior Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions:
Very elaborate multi-stage interview process.

Brief phone interview with HR rep, followed by remote 2.5-hour work assignment that required me to take the afternoon off from current job. Once assignment was passed, interview was scheduled two weeks later with 6-person panel (including one panelist on speakerphone) of dean and senior executives.
Interview Questions: Situational questions. For example, "Describe a time you were faced with a difficult communications problem at work. How did you approach it?"

title: Varsity Blues Promotion Team Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: It was a team interview process in a room with all the other interviewees, you are put into teams and they asked each team to answer questions about marketing or come up with solutions to scenarios
Interview Questions: They asked us scenario questions that we had to solve in terms of marketing the Varsity Blues

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Third-party platform, 3 questions and about 1-3 mins speaking time + 2-3 mins preparation time for each question. 1 question introducing yourself, 2 situational questions. You get practice questions. It required a webcame and high speed internet. You have to finish your interview before a deadline.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why you can succeed in engineering.

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied on the library website, got an email from the supervisor and met with two other supervisors  for the interview. They went through the resume together. After the interview, the supervisor has reached me back through an email and got the training a week after.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the certain library position?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: I had an informal interview. It was done via email opposed to over the phone and in person. The position was on a first come first serve basis, and about 15 people were hired.
Interview Questions: Have I had experience with working events?

title: Admissions and Recruitment Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was for 30
Mins. There was only one person the Director who interviewed. Was very comfortable and easy questioning. I was not prepared to answer as this was a short term vacancy. I was not serious about the position. But was a good learning experience.
Interview Questions: Was there a difficult situation at your previous workplace and how did you overcome it.

title: Lead Plasma Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with the Principal Investigator, first over email when I was still looking for a research place, and then in person when I'd settled on working for the group. We met and talked in his office before he took me on.
Interview Questions: To describe in detail what I'd done in my previous role as a Graduate Researcher. It was a mostly technical interview.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions:
I did my PhD here, since my supervisor and my committee members know me very well, there is no interview process.
I did my PhD here, since my supervisor and my committee members know me very well, there is no interview process.
Interview Questions: What is your research plan.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: One on one meeting with supervisor where they questioned level of related experience and questioned familiarity with various digital and physical tasks. Further questions were asked to understand general knowledge of the field with the research was in.
Interview Questions: What do you think this role will look like and what do you expect to be doing in this position?

title: Library Technologies & Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: 3 hour conference interview, U of T (m) advertised job requirements on the University Career portal. The process took 5 week (HR blackhole). One fine day I get a call asking for a group interview. Did a 3 hour mind numbing interview to find out that they had falsified the job requirements to attract talent to them. All of the requirements fell flat because the interviewers had no idea what to ask and neither did they know about the technologies required on the job. (AR/VR etc.). HR did no respond back following the interview even though I tried to confirm completion of the process.
Interview Questions: Standard question pre set question which they read off from a list. Complete waste of time.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Phone Call asking why I was interested and I explained why I was interested because I work in education before with children then they said they would let me know if i was hired in a few days and they did
Interview Questions: Why I was interested

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Met for a brief face-to-face interview, which was quite informal and lasted for about 10 minutes or so. This took place at a specific research lab in OISE. It was one-on-one with the lab manager.
Interview Questions: What skills or experiences do you have that are relevant to this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Strictly discussing credentials and knowledge in order to determine whether you can be trained appropriately. More time is spent discussing what it expected of you to evaluate whether you are suited for the position.
Interview Questions: A run through of your CV

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Each faculty member who are interested in the student  who usually have similar research background or molecular technical knowledge and experience  will be scheduled for the interview and ask previous research experiences and their interests in the research goals
Interview Questions: why would you like to join the lab

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: First interviewed by a post-doc, then interviewed by professor himself. Then the professor sent me a few papers, and asked me to send him a summary report. The professor was nice, more focused on the background and technical questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about what you learnt during your undergrad.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a brief in person panel interview with behavioural and skill testing questions. The process was straightforward and positive in general, and while it was brief it was quite in depth in terms of knowledge and skill questions asked.
Interview Questions: What teaching experiences do you have?

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: This employer sends out A LOT of postings for communications roles in different departments but it’s very difficult to get an interview as it seems many of the positions are filled internally. Once I did manage to secure an interview it was done in a small, dark and dingy room and the interviewer was very cold and stoic the entire time. It seemed more like a formality and I did not feel like I was being seriously considered for the role.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions but also some about the specific department and ways you can improve it, specific experience with digital platforms, etc.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: To get a TAship, usually, you should know the professor. You apply through the system and the professor will list you as his favorite candidate. You should apply to more than 1 opening because there is a high demand for TA positions.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the course?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 3 librarians present. They grilled me on character questions and situational questions. Overall they were less focused on the technical aspects of the job and more on the person. Overall good interview
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Apply on the group website of the selected supervisor. If your qualification meets the requirement, you will interview directly with the supervisor either face to face. Sometimes a presentation will be required as well.
Interview Questions: What is your research plan?

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: I received an email saying that I was selected for an interview. I arrived at the building for the in-person interview and it lasted about 15 minutes. There were two interviewers.
Interview Questions: Can you tell us about your volunteer or extracurricular activities?

title: Master Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Principal Investigator gave the interview, asked about my previous research experience and tried to gauge my understanding of her research. Principal investigator gave me a tour of the facility and had each student in her lab give me a mini interview so they could all determine if I was a good fit for the lab.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience leading a project in your Undergraduate degree.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Good interview quality, interviewer very nice and asked major relevant questions, got an offer at last and really helped me a lot when applying to grad school.  The University of Toronto has its great reputation and it turns out that the quality of research is totally worth its name.
Interview Questions: How are your courses taken related to the research project?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Got a job interview by employee referral. Shortly thereafter I expressed my interest I received a 1-in-1 interview. Interview questions were centred around skills required for the job and my experience in similar positions. Very straightforward questions, nothing unexpected.
Interview Questions: What is your competency in Adobe Photoshop?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: I sent an email to the professor who I's like to work with. Then we scheduled for a meeting. I presented my PhD research and I answered technical questions afterward. I was also asked about my future research ideas. I also talked about my future plan.
Interview Questions: What is your plan for future (after post-doctoral fellowship)

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process is very common. Questions about your work experience. They noted down what you had said. The job was easy to get because the work is not hard. The employers would ask very long questions. However, they are patient enough to repeat.
Interview Questions: What did you do when .... happened

title: Coop Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online, got an email to ask if I was available for an interview later that week. The actual interview was about half an hour,  but it was pretty relaxed and conversation like. Asked the basic interview questions, then some that were job specific. Then they asked if I had any questions and to explain how my previous experience would fit in.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Summer Research Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by PI directly in his office. They will ask you about your previous research experience. They will ask you to explain what your research interests are. They will ask you to explain how you think you can contribute to the lab
Interview Questions: Why did you select our lab?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: Did an interview with a professor for an intro computer science course TA position. Decent interview overall, asked basic questions about Python. For review viewers, just research some Python basics and you should be able to do well.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between a list and a tuple?

title: Full Stack Web Developer Teacher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions:
Although the University of Toronto apparently outsources headhunting to Trilogy Education for this position, I still think it's important for them to be accountable for their vendors.

A recruiter reached out through LinkedIn, asking me to setup some time with a different recruiter. 

I setup a call on Wednesday, at noon. The recruiter called me at 12:30, asking me to move it to Thursday at 2. I agreed.

He called back at 3:40 on Thursday, asking me to move it to 5. While I understand being late _or_ rescheduling once, being late _and_ rescheduling twice is very sad.

I didn't accept the rescheduling. While I'm looking forward to working with them, I don't like the lack of respect for my time that's been displayed so far.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview with PI only and no interview with the department needed. You seek out the PI on your own and ask for the interview. Discussed projects available and interests for the project and goals for the program.
Interview Questions: What are you hoping to get out of this program?

title: Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Thorough and difficult. It lasted close to an hour and I was pressed on a number of items on my resume. I learned a lot about how to conduct myself in these scenarios
Interview Questions: Describe personal attributes that would fit the role

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my CV by e-mail and had interviews by videoconferencing and in person. The first interview was a 1:1 Skype interview with the principal investigator, and the next interview was in person at the University where I had to present my Ph.D. research.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable working in a team

title: Train Conductor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: First you are invited to a group session followed by a switch test and if you pass that you are given a timeslot for an interview on the same day.
Interview Questions: What does safety mean to you?

title: Frontline Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toronto (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: 2 person interview with Manager and Director. There was also a situational test where we had to respond to a student's email and how to use ROSI at U of T for certain situations.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult customer?

title: Peer Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Toronto
Interview Descriptions: A one on one interview with straight forward, answerable questions. First asked "tell me about yourself." They also assessed your experiences working with others, facilitation skills, conflict management, and time-management skills.
Interview Questions: How will you balance this role with your other responsibilities?
